articles.author: Joan Glendinning
articles.title: Recreating a top down shooter in Unity
articles.description: Reproducing classic games can be a fun and rewarding experience for game developers, and Unity is a great platform for doing so. In my own experience, I decided to remake the popular top-down shooter minigame, Journey of the Prairie King, from Stardew Valley. This allowed me to not only learn how to use Unity and C#, but also gain a deeper understanding of the game mechanics and complexity.

articles.author: Joan Glendinning
articles.title: To do app in Android
articles.description: Java is a widely-used programming language, but it has been around for a while and is not considered as cutting-edge as some of the newer languages. However, I found that Java's robustness and stability made it a great choice for developing a reliable and user-friendly to do app. Despite the popularity of newer programming languages, I believe that Java still has a lot to offer for mobile app development.

articles.author: Joan Glendinning
articles.title: From Digital Designs to Tangible Creations: Exploring the World of 3D Printing
articles.description: Unlocking the potential of tomorrow's innovators, the world of PLA 3D printing is revolutionizing education today. Discover how the Ender 3 V2 is reshaping learning experiences and preparing students for a future where creativity, innovation, and hands-on skills are more essential than ever.
